did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections.

did.abstract: Ezra Pound (1885-1972) was a poet, translator, and a representative for Poetry magazine, and The little review. His published works include A lume spento (1908), Homage to Sextus Propertius (1917), and Hugh Selwyn Mauberly (1920). The collection contains Pound's correspondence with E.W. Titus, letters to various persons, corrected proofs of poems, typescripts, and issues of The Pound newsletter.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.
Portions of this collection are restricted from copying. Consult finding aid for additional information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Advance notice required for access.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ezra Pound Papers (Collection 636). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Pound was born in Hailey, Idaho on October 30, 1885; attended the University of Pennsylvania and Hamilton College; taught romance philology at Wabash College; left for Europe; in 1908 his first book of verse, A lume spento, was published; lived in London from 1908-20, where he published translations of Italian and Provençal poetry and adaptations from Chinese poems; published Homage to Sextus Propertius (1917) and Hugh Selwyn Mauberly (1920); served as London representative for Poetry magazine, and for The little review; began to write The cantos, the first of which was published in 1925; moved to Paris in 1920, and to Rapallo, Italy five years later; made pro-Fascist broadcasts from Italy after the U.S. declared war; was indicted for treason, held at a detention center in Pisa in 1945, and was transferred to St. Elizabeth's Hospital for the criminally insane in Washington, D.C. in 1946; awarded the Bollingen Prize for poetry in 1949; returned to Italy after his release in 1958; he died in Venice on November 1, 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains Pound correspondence with E.W. Titus, letters to various persons, corrected proofs of poems published in The little review, proofs of Certain noble plays of Japan with holograph corrections, typescript drafts of cantos xii and xiii, typescripts of the Noh stories, Moon madness and The rabbit's house, and ephemera. Also contains numbers 1-10 of The Pound newsletter and two reels of microfilm containing If this be treason... [n.p., c.1948] and The cantos of Ezra Pound.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Proofs revised by the author. Given to D.H. Lawrence about 1911.

did.physdesc: 10 leaves. Typescript with holograph corrections. In a black cloth case.

did.unittitle: ----. Demarcations and The Revolution Betrayed. in the British Union Quarterly, vol.1 no.1 and vol.2 no.1. January-April 1937 and January-March 1938.
----. Certain Noble Plays of Japan. Churchtown, Dundrum: The Cuala Press. 1916.
did.physdesc: Proof sheets with copious holograph corrections. In a blue morocco slipcase.

did.unittitle: ----. Certain Noble Plays of Japan. Churchtown, Dundrum: The Cuala Press. 1916.

list.item: 4 letters to Alfred Fowler, Editory of The Miscellany, Kansas City. London, ca. 1915 (9 leaves. Typescript and holograph).
1 letter to George S. Fraser. [Washington?] ca. 1949 (3 leaves. Typescript and holograph).
1 letter to Donald Pearce. Washington, December 6, 1953 (1 leaf. Typescript).
1 letter to Derek Stanford. Washington, January 15, 1949 (1 leaf. Holograph).
1 letter to Dear Sir. Venice, June 26, 1927 (2 leaves. Holograph).

did.unittitle: ----. The Little Review. May 1918. vol.6 no.1.

did.physdesc: 2 leaves. 31 × 21cm. Typescript with holograph corrections in pencil.

scopecontent.p: A Noh story translated from the Japanese. Original title: The Moon Faun. Printed in Miscellany, ca. 1915, published by the American Book Plate Society, 1914-1916.

did.unittitle: ----. The Rabbits' House. Translation. n.p. n.d
did.physdesc: 2 leaves. 31 × 21cm. Typescript with holograph corrections in pencil.

scopecontent.p: A Noh story translated from the Japanese. Printed in Miscellany, ca. 1915, published by the American Book Plate Society, 1914-1916.

did.unittitle: Fraser, George Sutherland, 1915- . News from South America. London: Harvill Press. 1949.

scopecontent.p: Presentation copy from George S. Fraser[?] to John Gawsworth [pseudonym for Terence Ian Fytton Armstrong] with Ezra Pound's comments, taken from an original letter from Pound to Fraser, copied on relevant pages by Fraser[?].

note.p: For this letter, SEE: Letters, signed, to various persons.

did.unittitle: Letters, signed, to various persons, v.p. v.d.

list.item: 1 letter to Derek Stanford, January 17, 1949.
1 letter to Donald Pearce, December 6, 1953.
4 letters to Alfred Fowler, ca. 1915.
1 letter to George S. Fraser, ca. 1949.

did.unittitle: If this be treason..., n.p., c. 1948.

scopecontent.p: Contents: E.E. Cummings/examined. - James Joyce: to his memory. - A french accent. - Canto 45. - Blast. Limited edition, copy no.21.

did.unittitle: The Cantos of Ezra Pound. New York: Farrar and Rinehart, c. 1933.

scopecontent.p: Some testimonies by Ernest Hemingway, Ford Madox Ford, T.S. Eliot, Hugh Walpole, Archibald MacLeish, James Joyce, and others.

list.item:
Jaime de Angulo Papers (Collection 160). Available at Department of Special Collections, UCLA.
(Letters to de Angulo in Box 2).

Earl Roy Miner Papers (Collection 821). Available at Department of Special Collections, UCLA.
(Letters to Miner in Box 1).

Harold Monro Papers (Collection 745). Available at Department of Special Collections, UCLA.
(Letters to Monro in Box 2).

Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection (Collection 100). Available at Department of Special Collections, UCLA.
(Letters to Frederic Manning in Box 101).
(Letter to Cyril M. Schneider about Nathaniel West in Box 36).

Peter Russell Papers (Collection 921). Available at Department of Special Collections, UCLA.
(Letters to Edgar Jepson, and E. Pound ephemera in Box 1).
